doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
early 20th century road construction in Albemarle County
Roads: early 20th century road construction in Albemarle County
early 20th century road construction in Albemarle County

Native American Indians hunted along Bison paths which later became the first roads--Generally the roads followed the ridges to avoid swamps and streams--The first record of a road in the county was in 1726 with the first order for a road occurring in 1731--Many were called Rolling Roads used to roll Hogsheads of tobacco in barrels with axles pulled by oxen to the James River
The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
